Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Halictine 2 (Halictine-2, HAL-2; XXA; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: venom, the eusocial bee, Halictus sexcinctus

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Highly active against B. subtilis, S. aureus, E. coli (MIC 0.8-7.7 uM) and moderately active against P. aeruginosa (MIC ~45 uM). Also active against C. albicans (MIC 6-7 uM) as well as cancer cells  such as Hela S3, CRC SW480, and CCRF-CEMT IC50 12-35 uM (Slaninova J et al. 2012 Peptides 33:18-26).Amyloid AMPs: LPS induced amyloid formation of Hal-2 (Wang et al., 2014).Structure: Secondary structures were determined by both CD and NMR.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: pET22b vector, sumo fusion protein, Ni2+ -NTA affinity chromatography, clleaved with sumo, HPLC purification.SAR: Numerous variants were generated to understand the sequence-activity relationships. Provided by Vaclav Cerovsky on Jannary 27, 2012.Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Monincová L, Budesínský M, Slaninová J, Hovorka O, Cvacka J, Voburka Z, Fucík V, Borovicková L, Bednárová L, Straka J, Cerovský V.2010, Czech, Europe
Literature Information.Title: Novel antimicrobial peptides from the venom of the eusocial bee Halictus sexcinctus (Hymenoptera: Halictidae) and their analogs
